data.description:
## Goal (WHY)
Demonstrate Sprint 3 capabilities: verifying understanding through generation and self-assessing learning needs.

## Deliverable
Create: scripts/sprint_29_demo.py

## Demo Requirements
1. Show comprehension: building initial understanding of input
2. Show implication generation: "if X is true, then Y should be true"
3. Show verification: checking implications against corpus/PLN
4. Show refinement: updating understanding when verification fails
5. Show learning recommendations: what to learn based on gaps
6. All assertions must pass

## Test Requirements
Location: tests/integration/test_sprint_29_demo.py

```python
def test_demo_runs_without_error():
    result = subprocess.run(["python", "scripts/sprint_29_demo.py"], ...)
    assert result.returncode == 0
    assert b"DEMO COMPLETE" in result.stdout
```

Verification: python scripts/sprint_29_demo.py && python -m pytest tests/integration/test_sprint_29_demo.py -v

## Anti-Patterns
- Do NOT create demo without self-verification
- Do NOT skip the generate-verify-refine cycle demonstration
- Do NOT skip self-assessment demonstration

## Freedom Zone
- Demo narrative and examples
- Output formatting
- Additional scenarios

## Definition of Done (Sprint 3 AND Epic)
When this task is complete:
- [ ] GenerativeUnderstandingLoop generates and verifies implications
- [ ] SelfAssessingMind integrates with MetacognitiveMonitor
- [ ] Demo script runs and self-verifies
- [ ] All tests pass with ≥95% coverage on new code
- [ ] Update cognitive_integration_demo.py with new capabilities

## Final Epic Demo
Update scripts/cognitive_integration_demo.py to include all Sprint 1-3 capabilities:
- Explanation chains (Sprint 1)
- Confidence tracking (Sprint 1)
- Analogical transfer (Sprint 2)
- Metacognitive assessment (Sprint 2)
- Generative understanding (Sprint 3)
- Self-assessment (Sprint 3)

## Reference: docs/definition-of-done.md
